trans-unit.source: Allows programmatic access to the HTML <xref uid="langword_csharp_<title>" name="<title>" href=""></xref> element on the server.
Use the HtmlTitle class to programmatically specify the HTML `<title>` element of a Web Forms page.

> [!NOTE] > You can also set the page title by using the `title` attribute of the [@ Page](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f06cf9e5-22bb-461d-8b8f-549e53ff40a4) directive, or by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.Title%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTitle"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTitle> control using default values.
It creates an HTML `<title>` element on the Web page.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTitle> class.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.TagName%2A>|The "title" literal string.|

Notifies the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTitle"></xref> control that an XML or HTML element was parsed and adds that element to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> collection of the control.

If the element added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTitle> control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.LiteralControl> control, then the AddParsedSubObject method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTitle.Text%2A> property with the value of the literal string; otherwise, the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.AddParsedSubObject%2A> method is called.
The AddParsedSubObject method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTitle> control.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the parsed element.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> collection for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTitle"></xref> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlCollection"></xref> object to contain the current server control's child server controls.
Renders the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTitle"></xref> control to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.
The Render method first calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method using the `Title` member of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag> enumeration.
Next, any child controls of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTitle> control are rendered.
Finally, the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderEndTag%2A> method is called.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that contains the output stream to render on the client.
Gets or sets the text of the HTML <xref uid="langword_csharp_<title>" name="<title>" href=""></xref> element.
Use the Text property to specify or determine the title of the Web page.
The text of the HTML <xref uid="langword_csharp_<title>" name="<title>" href=""></xref> element.
The default value is an empty string ("").
